message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the importance of roots to a tree's survival. When a tree is separated from its roots, it loses its source of water, nutrients, and stability. Without these essential elements, the tree will eventually die or "expire." Option (A) is incorrect because trees cannot move or run away. Option (C) is illogical because a tree cannot have a party. Option (D) is also incorrect because without roots, a tree cannot get stronger.

Option (A) is incorrect because trees cannot run away. Option (C) is unlikely because a tree cannot have a party without external factors. Option (D) is incorrect because without roots, a tree cannot get stronger.
